Name: Godot
Description: Free and open-source game engine under the MIT license.

Name: Game Maker Studio 2
Description: Uses GML Scripting, similar to JavaScript

Name: Game Maker Studio
Description: Uses GML Scripting, similar to JavaScript

Name: Scratch
Description: Education Tool designed to help teach kids programming my making games and animations.

Name: Lumberyard
Description: AAA game engine developed with an extensible C++ architecture. Deeply integrated with AWS and Twitch. Comes with full source. Games must use AWS for cloud services.

Name: Unigine
Description: Photorealistic graphics, large virtual worlds, with C++ and C# API.

Name: UPBGE
Description: Game Engine that is integrated with Blender

Name: Armory
Description: Plugin for Blender to make it a Game Engine

Name: Construct 3
Description: A browser based game engine. Excels at making HTML 5 games

Name: ink
Description: Interactive Fiction Game Tool. Also comes as a Unity Plugin

Name: Solar2D
Description: Open Source 2D game engine. Formerly known as Corona

Name: Babylon.JS
Description: JavaScript framework for building 3D games with HTML5, WebGL, WebVR, and Web Audio.

Name: OpenFL
Description: Uses an API similar to Adobe Flash's Actionscript, but exports as HTML5

Name: Flixel
Description: Library for making games in Adobe Flash's Actionscript

Name: Starling
Description: Make games using Adobe Air and Adobe Flash Actionscript

Name: HaxeFlixel
Platforms: Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android, Web
